briefTitle: Physical Activity, Alzheimer's Disease and Cognition Relative to APOE Genotype
officialTitle: The Effect of Physical Activity on Cognition Relative to APOE Genotype (PAAD-2)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Family History of Alzheimer's disease, cognitive impairment
* Able to communicate in English
* Not currently meeting recommendations for physical activity (the recommendations are to exercise 3 days/week for 30+ minutes per day for longer than 3 months)
* Willing to be randomized to either study condition
* Willing to complete all study activities for 1 year

Exclusion Criteria:

* Meet the criteria for clinical cognitive impairment
* Unable to perform physical activity due to known cardiovascular, metabolic, or renal disease and are symptomatic or due to orthopedic limitations
* Self-report history of confounding neurologic, psychiatric, or active severe or functionally disabling neurologic or medical diseases, or any other conditions that might limit exercise or pose a danger to the patient
* Current use of medications to treat symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, that adversely affect cognition, or that impact heart rate
* Meet the criteria for depression using the short form of the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale
* Traveling for an extended period (\>1 month) during the course of the study

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of executive function as measured with Stroop Interference
primary.description: Change in executive function will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on Stroop Interference.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of executive function as measured with Trail Making Test Interference
primary.description: Change in executive function will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on Trail Making Test interference.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of executive function as measured with Dimensional Change Card Sort
primary.description: Change in executive function will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on Dimensional Change Card Sort

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of executive function as measured with the Flanker test.
primary.description: Change in executive function will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Flanker test.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of executive function as measured with Matrix Reasoning.
primary.description: Change in executive function will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on Matrix Reasoning.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of memory as measured with the Auditory Verbal Learning Test.
primary.description: Change in memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Auditory Verbal Learning Test.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of memory as measured with the Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test
primary.description: Change in memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of memory as measured with the Picture Sequence test
primary.description: Change in memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Picture Sequence test.

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of memory as measured with the Mnemonic Similarity Test
primary.description: Change in memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Mnemonic Similarity Test

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of attention as measured with the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test
primary.description: Change in attention will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of attention as measured with the Forward Digit Span test
primary.description: Change in attention will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Forward Digit Span

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of working memory as measured with List Sort Working Memory
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the List Sort Working Memory

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of working memory as measured with Spatial Working Memory
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Spatial Working Memory

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of working memory as measured with Backward Digit Span
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Backward Digit Span

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of processing speed as measured with the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS-IV) Digit Symbol Task
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS-IV) Digit Symbol Task

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of processing speed as measured with the Stroop Color Test
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Stroop Color Test

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of processing speed as measured with the Stroop Word Test
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Stroop Word Test

primary.measure: Change in performance on the cognitive domain of processing speed as measured with the Trail Making Test A
primary.description: Change in working memory will be assessed by comparing post-, mid-, and pre-test performance on the Trail Making Test A

secondary.measure: Change in brain morphology (whole brain and hippocampal volumes)
secondary.description: MRI will be used to measure brain morphology including whole brain and hippocampal volumes and change will be assessed from pre-test to post-test.
Functional MRI will be used to measure brain activity including resting-state connectivity and change will be assessed from pre-test to post-test.

secondary.measure: Change in blood biomarkers (BDNF, irisin, IGF-1, glucose, insulin, TNF-⍺, serum amyloid protein (SAP), albumin, ApoE and ⍺-2 macroglobulin)
secondary.description: Blood samples will be taken following a 12-hour fast. Assays will be conducted for brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF), irisin, insulin-like growth factor (IGF)-1, glucose, insulin, tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-⍺, serum amyloid protein (SAP), albumin, apolipoprotein E (ApoE) and ⍺-2 macroglobulin. Change from pre-test to post-test will be assessed.

Fitness will be assessed using a submaximal graded aerobic exercise test performed on a treadmill. Oxygen uptake (VO2) will be measured during a ramped exercise protocol performed until volitional exhaustion or test termination due to symptom limitations. Change across time will be assessed.
